categories.title: Building a Swarm of Interoperable Agents

content.text: We're building a swarm of agents that interoperate and perform critical functions needed by communities, DAOs, and remote teams. These agents can be composed to solve any business process, and anyone can create agents that integrate into the swarm. The swarm is decentralized, allowing organizations to pick and choose the agents that best suit their needs.
Big updates for Fleek AI Agents have been announced, featuring improvements that provide more control, better interactions, and a fresh new experience.

A collaborative effort is underway to build a swarm of AI agents that can interoperate and perform critical functions for communities, DAOs, and remote teams. These agents can be composed to solve any business process, and anyone can create agents that integrate into the swarm. The swarm is decentralized, allowing organizations to pick and choose the agents that best suit their needs.

Development efforts have been focused on fixing three bugs, with contributions from 13 developers resulting in the merging of four pull requests. Major work included various improvements to the system.
Fleek AI Agents have received significant updates, offering users more control, better interactions, and a refreshed interface.
An AI Agent hacker house event was held at Ethereum Denver, featuring collaborations with ElizaOS and Eigenlayer.
A humorous suggestion was made to vote for a phone model to annoy AI enthusiasts.
